alert.note: Alert for Appling; Atkinson; Bacon; Echols; Northern Ware; Pierce; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 12:41AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Columbia, northeastern Hamilton, northwestern Camden, Pierce, eastern Echols, Brantley, Clinch, northern Charlton, southeastern Atkinson, Ware, southeastern Bacon, southwestern Wayne and southeastern Appling Counties through 130 AM EST... At 1241 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 11 miles north of Needmore, or 11 miles north of Fargo, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waycross, Alma, Blackshear, Homerville, Nahunta, Patterson, Fargo, Argyle, Stephen Foster State Park and Screven. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EST for northern Florida...and southeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Appling; Atkinson; Bacon; Echols; Northern Ware; Pierce; Wayne
